Articles.Content:
5 hours ago, hemeac said:

hope people make backups of their saves.

While always good advice, that shouldn't really be necessary for the CKAN release.  We worked hard to ensure it is "safe" if not absolutely 100.00% bug free.  You should be aware on any update "weird things" (tm) can occur, but nothing that'll corrupt your savegame or anything.  We worked hard to ensure it's certainly very safe that way.

Really the majority of bugs I have on my fix list are more convenience fixes for planet-pack authors, and end-users won't even care too much other than enjoying the work they will be able to do.

At any rate, starting work on KittopiaTech at noon PST today.  Wish me luck.

Edited August 22, 2020 by R-T-B

Bad news all.
My primary work machine was victim of a stray screw somehow, working it's way lose and shorting out my entire system by letting out the magic smoke.

Good news is I tested components in my brothers PC and only the motherboard seems destroyed.  Bad news is sourcing a new motherboard during this pandemic is slow...  so I'm probably going to be out coding wise for a good week at least (amazon shipping estimate).

Yeah, never let the magic smoke out kids.  It's what makes your PC work, and once it's out, it never goes back in.  Which sucks.  Plus it smells like toxic major bad stuff.

 

Edited August 23, 2020 by R-T-B

That is so 2020 of you.

Peace.

2 hours ago, StoneWolfPC said:

I don't know if I should laugh or cry at this or both. lmao.  Anything we can do from our end as users and testers?

Find the bugs so I have a hefty list when I get back, I guess?

I'm also accepting (but not asking) for donations unofficially.  If you can and want to contribute, pm me for a paypal link.  I can't/won't ask for more than the motherboards $150 cost though, and remember, development continues at the same time regardless.  For full disclosure, the total donation thus far has been $35 from one user.  Up to him to identify himself, I can only confirm.

If the above is against forum policy, mods can remove.

 

Edited August 25, 2020 by R-T-B
Just a shout out, sorry to hear about the computer burning up.  You have fans.

Best of luck. Make sure to double check for random screws and other bits of metal in the case before powering it on.
the 1.10.1 kopernicus breaks the menu ui for me

8 hours ago, [email protected] said:

the 1.10.1 kopernicus breaks the menu ui for me

If you are experiencing what I think you are, it's a known bug.  You should be able to navigate the menu using the keyboard.  It's just the mouse functionality that's broken.

9 hours ago, [email protected] said:

the 1.10.1 kopernicus breaks the menu ui for me

And it is very much a work in progress and has thus been labeled "pre-release". I highly recommend going back to 1.9, which has gotten an official (and stable) release.

21 hours ago, OhioBob said:

If you are experiencing what I think you are, it's a known bug.  You should be able to navigate the menu using the keyboard.  It's just the mouse functionality that's broken.

That SHOULD be fixed, but it would not surprise me if it crops up for some odd configurations or something.  Just because it can.

Oh yes and I'm finally back.  I got done with my reinstall post-motherboard arrival, which took way longer than it needed to (I didn't expect to have to do a reinstall at all, but at least it's done now).

I'm going to work on the bleeding edge to smash some bugs.  Once we have some good bug smashing done there, we'll probably drop another stable release on the 1.9 branch and maybe, if we're really lucky, we can talk about promoting 1.10.1.  But that's a ways off.

20 hours ago, prestja said:

And it is very much a work in progress and has thus been labeled "pre-release". I highly recommend going back to 1.9, which has gotten an official (and stable) release.

This is the safest route.  But if you want to diagnose with me, you can always play that game too, just send me a log file from when it happens if you could.

On 8/27/2020 at 7:31 PM, MechBFP said:

Best of luck. Make sure to double check for random screws and other bits of metal in the case before powering it on.  

I shook each component before inserting it, listening for rattling metal.   lol I'm paranoid now.  But hey, what's a little component shaking vs an exploding computer?  I think I'll do it from now on.

Edited August 31, 2020 by R-T-B

Not a bug, but still, a problem:

I have a fairly weak cpu. So frames / s are important to me. I have a craft with 76 parts. and i was getting like 11 fps. That's low even for my rig. I get a kerbal out and start disasembling components to see wich ones are cpu hoggers. Guess what : SOLAR PANELS !!!!

After taking out 11 ox-stat solar panels ( you know, the ones that are supposed to be phisycles parts in order to conserve cpu....!!! ) my frames went up from 11 to 20. Yaay. game is now playable !!!

Anyway, on a huch i tested with a shrouded solar panel (the spw 3x2). as slong as its shrouded; 20 fps. expand it : 17 fps. Crap. I wanted a reason to use fuel cels; now i have one.

 

Now I'm pretty sure stock game doesn't eat that much cpu/solar, so I'm gonna guess it's kopernikus.

ksp 1.9.1, GPP.

On 8/31/2020 at 8:00 AM, R-T-B said:

I shook each component before inserting it, listening for rattling metal.   lol I'm paranoid now.  But hey, what's a little component shaking vs an exploding computer?  I think I'll do it from now on.

Magnets are once again your friend in the day and age of the SSD.

Do i need to download the source code?

3 hours ago, colonelkittenz said:

Do i need to download the source code?

Do i need to download the source code? also if i do, do i put it in the game data folder like all the others?

No, just download the other zip for your version, not the source code.

On 9/1/2020 at 11:40 AM, Nicky21 said:

Not a bug, but still, a problem:

I have a fairly weak cpu. So frames / s are important to me. I have a craft with 76 parts. and i was getting like 11 fps. That's low even for my rig. I get a kerbal out and start disasembling components to see wich ones are cpu hoggers. Guess what : SOLAR PANELS !!!!

After taking out 11 ox-stat solar panels ( you know, the ones that are supposed to be phisycles parts in order to conserve cpu....!!! ) my frames went up from 11 to 20. Yaay. game is now playable !!!

Anyway, on a huch i tested with a shrouded solar panel (the spw 3x2). as slong as its shrouded; 20 fps. expand it : 17 fps. Crap. I wanted a reason to use fuel cels; now i have one.

 

Now I'm pretty sure stock game doesn't eat that much cpu/solar, so I'm gonna guess it's kopernikus.

ksp 1.9.1, GPP.

 

We can look at optimizing them some, the new multistar math is probably to blame.  Can I get your actual CPU just so I know what we are dealing with?  No shame.

You can turn off the new solar panels with a small cfg bit.  Just throw the following in a cfg file in gamedata.  This will restore stock behavior, which is fine for singlestar systems. 

@PART:HAS[@MODULE[ModuleDeployableSolarPanel]]:FINAL
{
    useKopernicusSolarPanels = False
}
Edited September 4, 2020 by R-T-B
